versos: (joah) 2 Kings 18:18 - "Josah the son of Asemath, the interpreter.";;;
(trustest) Psalm 37:3 - "Trust in the LORD, and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.";;;
(amoz) Isaiah 1:1 - The vision concerning Judah and Jerusalem that Isaiah son of amoz saw during the reigns of Uzziah
(reprove) Proverbs 9:8 - "reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.";;;
(rumour) Proverbs 13:3 - "Those who guard their lips preserve their lives, but those who speak rashly will come to ruin.";;;
(bridle) Psalm 32:9 - Do not be like the horse or the mule
(cain) Genesis 4:1 - "Now Adam knew Eve his wife, and she conceived and bore cain, saying, 'I have gotten a man with the help of the Lord.'";;;
(tears) Psalm 56:8 - "You have kept count of my tossings; put my tears in your bottle. Are they not in your record";;;
(lump) Romans 11:16 - "If the part of the dough offered as firstfruits is holy, then the whole batch is holy; if the root is holy, so are the branches.";;;
(laish) Judges 18:28 - And there was no deliverer
(jonathan) 1 Samuel 14:4 - On each side of the pass that jonathan intended to cross to reach the Philistine outpost was a cliff; one was called Bozez and the other Seneh.;;
(degrees) 2 Kings 20:10 - "And Hezekiah answered, It is a light thing for the shadow to go down ten degrees: nay, but let the shadow return backward ten degrees.";;;
(courts) Psalm 116:19 - "in the courts of the house of the Lord, in your midst, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord";;;
(wipe) Isaiah 25:8 - He will swallow up death forever. The Sovereign LORD will wipe away the tears from all faces; he will remove his peoples disgrace from all the earth. The LORD has spoken.;;
(uzza) 2 Samuel 6:6 - When they came to the threshing floor of Nakon
(adaiah) 2 Chronicles 17:8 - "With them were Adonijah and his followers, and he put himself forward and said, 'I will become king.'";;;
(shaphan) 2 Kings 22:3 - "In the eighteenth year of his reign, King Josiah sent the secretary, shaphan son of Azaliah, the son of Meshullam, to the temple of the Lord.";;;
